TopicTitle: Need recruits for a starmade faction (Nextech Enterprises Recruiting)

Articles.Content: So its the "Banana Pirates" Thats our enemy, They dont have a listed homebase which is a good strategy for a pirate faction, But they must have someplace where they put there ships when they log off, What if one of us logs in under a different profile and joins them so that they will show that person the base then when they log off we will remove the faction blocks on all there ships and take them ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)
Now that is sneaky.

> 
> Now that is sneaky.

Sneaky indeed.

But all's fair in love and war. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

The ships were docked, yes. However, all the docking areas were missing. (Rails)

I believe they torched the rails and separated the ships. They also stole the factory enhancers there, and the massive ore deposits.
What would be even sneakier would be to find the location, write it down, log back in our regular profiles, and get all our allies to go on attack with us and totally demolish them.
Agreed. LETS DO IT! Muhahahaa!

Just finished my first fighter/battleship: Bacon Warrior I.

![rzJsPZ7.png](http://i.imgur.com/rzJsPZ7.png)

As you might guess, my main source of damage comes from those turrets.

I'm going to go try her out against some pirates.

EDIT: Nope. Ran out of shields and had my turrets taken right off. Still in pretty good shape though.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-04T22:01:21Z" title="07/04/2015 10:01  PM" data-short="9 yr">July 4, 2015</time> by Vaporo**

I tested my new ship against TWO pirate stations an Eta and a Delta and i Destroyed the Eta and Disable the Delta it is now an outpost ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

we should have a board in the homebase with the location of all the outposts.

Also if they have a claimed system we could use the galaxy map to filter by faction relation

Two members of the Banana Pirate faction are online right now. Is the operation a go?

I'm willing to wait for quite some time to get my revenge. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Here's what I'm thinking we do, step by step

1) I log on under a different profile name, totally random and/or stupid.

1.1 Addendum) We need to test in our own faction if I can cut through blocks with the torch if I'm not factioned, or if I'm low-level in the faction and don't have permission to edit.

2) One of you sends me a bunch of credits/we get a torch and grapple and send a ship over to spawn to give it to me.

3) I get on these people's good side, try and see if they've got a base. If they do and the ships are there, wonderful. If they don't, not so wonderful. (If they come and pick me up in my AUS-2 I'll be laughing so hard. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif))

4) Head to base and mark coords.

5) Sabotage with torches, take the faction modules out, dock everything together (Should bring a bunch of docking equipment), and escape.

or

5a) We get a bunch of warships ready and nuke the place.

Would it be *too* evil if I first joined Nextech Enterprises under the fake name, pretend to want to work as an undercover agent for them, "steal" a ship from our own faction while you guys are online, just to build trust, and then betray them? ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Sidonus said that they strand there ships in space where noone will find them, but if they have an outpost we should destroy it and maybe trick them into letting us know where they stashed the ships.

Im building the first titan now >![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) it will have 50mil shields ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Titan is taking shape now but i'd like you guys to make contributions to it because it really is a bit too much for me alone.
